TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract MailMergeFields implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of objects that represent the mail merge related fields in a document.

remarks.para: Use the property to return the MailMergeFields collection.
Use the method to add a merge field to the MailMergeFields collection.
Use Fields(), where is the index number, to return a single MailMergeField object.
The MailMergeFields collection has additional methods, such as and , for adding fields related to a mail merge operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField Add (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string Name);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField Add([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string Name) runtime managed
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::MailMergeField ^ Add(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range, System::String ^ Name);

Docs.param: Required object. The range where you want the field to appear. This field replaces the range, if the range isn't collapsed.
Required String. The name of the field.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents a mail merge field added to the data source document.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddAsk (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string Name, ref object Prompt, ref object DefaultAskText, ref object AskOnce);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddAsk([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string Name, [in]object& Prompt, [in]object& DefaultAskText, [in]object& AskOnce) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the ASK field.
Required String. The bookmark name that the response or default text is assigned to. Use a REF field with the bookmark name to display the result in a document.
Optional Object. The text that's displayed in the dialog box.
Optional Object. The default response, which appears in the text box when the dialog box is displayed. Corresponds to the \d switch for an ASK field.
Optional Object. True to display the dialog box only once instead of each time a new data record is merged. Corresponds to the \o switch for an ASK field.
Docs.summary: Adds an ASK field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: When updated, an ASK field displays a dialog box that prompts you for text to assign to the specified bookmark.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddFillIn (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, ref object Prompt, ref object DefaultFillInText, ref object AskOnce);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddFillIn([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]object& Prompt, [in]object& DefaultFillInText, [in]object& AskOnce) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the FILLIN field.
Optional Object. The text that's displayed in the dialog box.
Optional Object. The default response, which appears in the text box when the dialog box is displayed. Corresponds to the \d switch for an FILLIN field.
Optional Object. True to display the prompt only once instead of each time a new data record is merged. Corresponds to the \o switch for a FILLIN field. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Adds a FILLIN field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: When updated, a FILLIN field displays a dialog box that prompts you for text to insert into the document at the location of the FILLIN field.
Use the method with the collection object to add a FILLIN field to a document other than a mail merge main document.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddIf (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string MergeField, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, ref object CompareTo, ref object TrueAutoText, ref object TrueText, ref object FalseAutoText, ref object FalseText);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddIf([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string MergeField, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, [in]object& CompareTo, [in]object& TrueAutoText, [in]object& TrueText, [in]object& FalseAutoText, [in]object& FalseText) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the IF field.
Required String. The merge field name.
Required . The operator used in the comparison.
Optional Object. The text to compare with the contents of .
Optional Object. The AutoText entry that's inserted if the comparison is true. If this argument is specified, is ignored.
Optional Object. The text that's inserted if the comparison is true.
Optional Object. The AutoText entry that's inserted if the comparison is false. If this argument is specified, is ignored.
Optional Object. The text that's inserted if the comparison is false.
Docs.summary: Adds an IF field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: When updated, an IF field compares a field in a data record with a specified value, and then it inserts the appropriate text according to the result of the comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddMergeRec (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddMergeRec([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range) runtime managed
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::MailMergeField ^ AddMergeRec(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range);

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the MERGEREC field.
Docs.summary: Adds a MERGEREC field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A MERGEREC field inserts the number of the current data record (the position of the data record in the current query result) during a mail merge.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddMergeSeq (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddMergeSeq([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range) runtime managed
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::MailMergeField ^ AddMergeSeq(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range);

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the MERGESEQ field.
Docs.summary: Adds a MERGESEQ field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A MERGESEQ field inserts a number based on the sequence in which data records are merged (for example, when record 50 of records 50 to 100 is merged, MERGESEQ inserts the number 1).

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddNext (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddNext([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range) runtime managed
public: Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::MailMergeField ^ AddNext(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range);

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the NEXT field.
Docs.summary: Adds a NEXT field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A NEXT field advances to the next data record so that data from more than one record can be merged into the same merge document (for example, a sheet of mailing labels).

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddNextIf (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string MergeField, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, ref object CompareTo);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddNextIf([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string MergeField, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, [in]object& CompareTo) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the NEXTIF field.
Required String. The merge field name.
Required . The operator used in the comparison.
Required String. The text to compare with the contents of .
Docs.summary: Adds a NEXTIF field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A NEXTIF field compares two expressions, and if the comparison is true, the next data record is merged into the current merge document.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddSet (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string Name, ref object ValueText, ref object ValueAutoText);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddSet([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string Name, [in]object& ValueText, [in]object& ValueAutoText) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the SET field.
Required String. The bookmark name that is assigned to.
Optional Object. The text associated with the bookmark specified by the argument.
Optional Object. The AutoText entry that includes text associated with the bookmark specified by the argument. If this argument is specified, is ignored.
Docs.summary: Adds a SET field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A SET field defines the text of the specified bookmark.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddSkipIf (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, string MergeField, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, ref object CompareTo);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.MailMergeField AddSkipIf([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string MergeField, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdMailMergeComparison Comparison, [in]object& CompareTo) runtime managed

Docs.param: Required object. The location for the SKIPIF field.
Required String. The merge field name.
Required . The operator used in the comparison.
Optional Object. The text to compare with the contents of .
Docs.summary: Adds a SKIPIF field to a mail merge main document. Returns a object.

remarks.para: A SKIPIF field compares two expressions, and if the comparison is true, SKIPIF moves to the next data record in the data source and starts a new merge document.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Creator { get; }
.property instance int32 Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.
